title: Foundation University Ordinance, 2002
description: Official consolidated text of Foundation University Ordinance, 2002 (LXXXVIII of 2002) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 13. Functions of the Discipline Committee
provisions.content:
ORDINANCE LXXXVIII OF 2002
[25th October, 2002]
An Ordinance, to provide for the establishment of a Foundation University at Islamabad
WHEREAS it is in the interest of country to establish a centre of excellence to provide quality
education of international standard to talented students of Pakistan;
AND WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of the Foundation University
and for matters ancillary thereto or connected therewith;
AND WHEREAS the President is satisfied that circumstances exist which render it necessary
to take immediate action;
NOW, THEREFORE, in pursuance of the Proclamation of Emergency of the Fourteenth day
of October, 1999, and the Provisional Constitution Order No. 1 of 1999, read with the Provisional
Constitution (Amendment) Order No.9 of 1999, and in exercise of all powers enabling him in that
behalf, the President of the, Islamic Republic of Pakistan is pleased to make and promulgate the
following Ordinance:―

provisions.title: Section 1. Short title and commencement
provisions.content:
_(1) This Ordinance may be called the Foundation
University Ordinance, 2002. (2) It shall come into force at once.

provisions.title: Section 2. Definitions
Section 3. Establishment and Incorporation of the University
provisions.content:
_(1) There shall be established at
Islamabad a University to be called the Foundation University consisting of--
(a)     the Patron, the Chancellor, the President, the Rector, the Deans, the Directors,
the Principals and other members of the Board of Governors;
(b)     the members of councils, boards, committees and other bodies as the Board may
establish;
(c)     the teachers and students of the University and its constituent units; and
(d)     such other officers and members of the staff as the Board may, from time to
time, specified;
(2) The University shall be a body corporate by the name of the Foundation University,
Islamabad having perpetual succession and a common seal, with power, among others, to acquire, hold
and dispose of any property or investments and shall by the said name sue and be sued.
(3) The principal seat of the University shall be at Islamabad and it may set up its campuses,
colleges, institutes, officers, research/study centres and other facilities at such places in Pakistan as
Board of Governors may determine. The additional campuses shall be set in other parts of the country
only after their evaluation by the Higher Education Commission to determine whether they meet the
eligibility criteria fixed by the Higher Education commission.

provisions.title: Section 4. University open to all classes, creeds, etc
provisions.content:
_ The University shall be open to persons of
either sex of whatever religion, rape, creed, colour or domicile who are academically qualified for
admission to the courses of study offered by the University and no such person shall be denied the
privileges of the University on the ground only for sex, religion, creed, race, class, colour or domicile.

provisions.title: Section 5. Functions and powers of the University.___ The University shall have the powers
Section 6. Teaching and examination of University
provisions.content:
_(1) The academic programmes of the
University shall be conducted in the prescribed manner.
(2) The University shall associate external examiners for the conduct of examination.
(3) No degree shall be granted unless a student has passed an examination in Islamic Studies
and Pakistan Studies at the Bachelor's degree level or, in the case of a non- Muslim student, in Ethics
and Pakistan Studies as his option.
(4) In the prescribing syllabi, courses of studies and instructions for the conduct of studies, the
University shall abide by the directions given by the HEC under the Higher Education Commission
Ordinance, 2002 (LIII of 2002). for Federal Supervision of Curricula. Textbooks and Maintenance of
Standards of Education.

provisions.title: Section 7. Authorities of the University
Section 8. Officers of the University
Section 9. The Patron
provisions.content:
_(1) The President of Pakistan shall be the Patron of the University.
(2) The Patron, when present or his nominee shall preside at the convocations of the University.
(3) Every proposal to confer an honorary degree shall be subject to confirmation by the Patron.

provisions.title: Section 10. Visitation by the Patron
provisions.content:
_(1) The Patron may cause an inspection or inquiry to be made
on his own motion or at the request of the HEC in respect of any matter connected with the affairs of
the University and shall, from time to time, direct any person of persons to inquire into or carry out
inspection of___
(a)     the University, its buildings, laboratories, libraries, and other facilities;
(b)     any institution, department or hostel maintained by the University;
(c)     the adequacy of financial and human resources;
(d)     the teaching, research, curriculum, examination and other matters of th
University; and
(e)     such other matters as the Patron may specify.
(2) The Patron shall communicate to the respective Board his views with regard to the results
of visitation and shall', after ascertaining the views of the respective Board, advise the Board on the
action to be taken by it.
(3) The respective Board shall, within such time as may be specified by the Chancellor,
communicate to him such action, if any, as has been taken or may be proposed to be taken upon
the results of visitation.
(4) Where the respective Board does not, within the time specified, take action to the
satisfaction of the Patron, the Patron may issue such directions as he deems fit and the respective
Board shall comply with all such direction.

provisions.title: Section 11. The Chancellor.
provisions.content:
_(1) The Chairman of Fauji Foundation shall be the Chancellor of the
University.
(2) The Chancellor shall appoint the Rector on the Recommendation on the Board of
Governors of the University.
(3) If the Chancellor is satisfied that the proceedings of any Authority or orders of any officer
are not in accordance with the provisions of this Ordinance, the statutes, the regulations or the rules,
he may after calling upon such Authority or officer to show- cause why such proceedings should not
be annulled by order in writing, annul such proceedings or order.
(4) The Chancellor may remove any person from the membership of any Authority if such
person___
(a)     has become of unsound mind; or
(b)     has been incapacitated to function as a member of such Authority has been
convicted by a Court of law or an offence involving moral turpitude or has
been found indulging in any activity against the interest of !he University.
(c)     should the Chancellor be incapacitated from acting as such due to absence or
any other cause, the President or a nominee of the Chancellor shall act for him.

provisions.title: Section 12. The President.___ The Managing Director of Fauji Foundation shall be the ex
provisions.content:
officio
president and chief executive officer of the University.

provisions.title: Section 14. The Rector
provisions.content:
_(1) The Rector, who shall be an eminent scholar of national repute and
an educationist or scientist of distinction, shall be appointed by the Chancellor on the
recommendation of the President on such terms and conditions as he may determine.
(2) At any time when the office of the Rector is vacant, or he is absent or unable to perform
the functions of his office due to illness or some other reason, the President shall make such
arrangements for the performance of the duties of the Rector as he may deem fit.
(3) The Rector shall be the chief academic and administrative officer of the University and
shall be responsible for the implementation of the decisions and for the execution of the programmes
of the University in accordance with the guidelines and policies formulated by the Board of
Governors.
(4) The Rector may, in an emergency which in his opinion requires immediate action, take
such action as he may consider necessary and shall, thereafter, as soon as possible, report his action to
the officer, authority, or other body, which in the ordinary course would have dealt with the matter.
(5) The Rector shall also have power___
(a)     to regulate the activities connected with the execution of programmes for
instructions, training, research, and similar services;
(b)     to create and fill temporary posts for a period not exceeding six months.
(c)     to sanction all expenditure provided for in the approved budget and the re-
appropriate funds within the same major head of expenditure;
(d)     to sanction and, re-appropriate an amount not exceeding one hundred
thousand rupees for an unforeseen item not provided for in the budget and
report it to the Board of Governors in the next meeting;
(e)     to appoint, with the approval of the Board of Governors, teachers, officers and
members of the staff of the University and such other persons as may be
necessary in accordance with policies and procedures approved by the Board
of Governors;
(f)    to submit to the Board of Governors, in accordance with the rules of procedure,
reports on the activities of the University and the execution of the plans of
work;
(g)    to appoint, paper setters and examiners for all examinations of the University;
(h)    to direct teachers, officers and other employees of the University to take up
such assignments in connection with teaching, research, examinations and
administration and such other activities in the University, as he may consider
necessary;
(i)    to delegate, subject to such conditions, if any, as may be prescribed, any
of his powers under this Ordinance, to an officer or other employee of the
University; and
(j)    to exercise and perform such other powers and functions as may be prescribed.

provisions.title: Section 15. The Board of Governors
Section 16. Powers and functions of the Board of Governors.___(1) The Board of Governors shall
Section 17. Meeting of the Board of Governors
provisions.content:
_(1) The Board shall meet at least twice year on
dates to be fixed by the Chancellor provided that a special meeting may be called at any time by the
Chancellor or on a request by not less than five members of the Board to consider any matter of urgent
nature.
(2) In the case of a special meeting not less than ten clear days notice shall be given to the
members of the Board and the agenda of the meeting shall be restricted to the matter for which the
special meeting is called.
(3) The quorum for a meeting of the Board shall be one-half of its members, fraction being
counted as one.
(4) The decisions of the Board shall be expressed in terms of the views of the majority and
voting of the members present. If the members are equally divided, the Chairman shall have the power
to exercise a casting vote.

provisions.title: Section 18. Executive Committee
Section 19. Academic Council
Section 20. Powers and duties of the Academic Council
Section 21. Appointments
provisions.content:
_ The University may appoint such persons in its service as may be
necessary on such terms and conditions as the Board may by rules determine.

provisions.title: Section 22. Committees
provisions.content:
_ The Board, the Academic Council, and other Authorities may constitute
such committees as may be deemed necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance.

provisions.title: Section 23. Delegation of Powers
provisions.content:
_ The Board may delegate to any person or a committee any of its
powers, duties or functions.

provisions.title: Section 24. University Fund
provisions.content:
_ There shall be a fund to be known as the “Foundation University
Fund” to which shall be credited all sums received by the University.

provisions.title: Section 25. Budget and Accounts
provisions.content:
_(1)The budget of the University shall be approved and its
accounts shall be maintained and audited in such manner as may be prescribed.

provisions.title: Section 26. Statutes
provisions.content:
_(1) The Board may make Statutes for the administration and management of
the University .
(2) The Statutes set out in the Schedule to this Ordinance shall be deemed to be the First Statutes
framed under subsection (1) and shall remain in force until they are amended or replaced by new
Statutes made in accordance with subsection.

provisions.title: Section 27. Regulations
provisions.content:
_ The Academic Council may with the approval of the Board, make
Regulations for the proper standards of instruction, training, research and examinations.

provisions.title: Section 28. Rules
provisions.content:
_(1) Authorities and the other bodies of the University may make Rules consistent
with this Ordinance, Statutes and Regulations, to regulate the conduct of their business and the time
and place of meetings and related matters.
(2) The Board may make rules to regulate any matter relating to the affairs of the University,
which under this Ordinance, are not specifically required to be provided for by the Statutes or the
Regulations.

provisions.title: Section 29. Discipline
provisions.content:
_ The University shall have power to supervise and control the discipline of
the, students of the University in the prescribed manner.

provisions.title: Section 30. Removal of difficulties.―If any difficulty arises in giving effect to any of the provisions
provisions.content:
of this Ordinance, the President may, on the recommendations of the Board make such order not
inconsistent with the said provisions, as it may consider necessary for the removal of such difficulty.
